data.job_description:
About the Company: Oeson is a leading IT corporation globally recognized for its expertise in providing top-notch IT and Ed-tech services. Specializing in digital marketing, data science, data analytics, UI-UX design, web development, and app development, we are dedicated to innovation, excellence, and empowering talents worldwide.

Learn More: www.oesonlearning.com

Job Summary:

Oeson is seeking enthusiastic individuals who are looking to learn with us in the field of Data Science while working on live projects internationally. We are not just offering a flexible work environment but also offering to work with people in a global team.

Projects You Will Work On:

- Finance Fraud Detection: Develop advanced fraud detection algorithms leveraging financial data analysis.

- Recommender System: Contribute to personalized recommendation systems, enhancing user experiences across platforms.

- Sentiment Analysis: Explore sentiment analysis to extract insights from textual data, shaping user sentiment understanding.

- Chatbots: Engage in intelligent chatbot development, revolutionizing customer interactions and support.

- Image/Audio Video Classification: Push boundaries with multimedia technology by working on image and audio video classification projects.

- Text Analysis: Uncover hidden patterns in textual data through sophisticated text analysis techniques.

Roles & Responsibilities:

- Collaborate with our esteemed data science experts to collect, clean, and analyze extensive datasets, honing skills in data preprocessing and visualization.

- Contribute to the development of predictive models and algorithms, employing cutting-edge machine learning techniques to solve real-world challenges.

- Work closely with team members to design, implement, and evaluate experiments, fostering a collaborative and innovative environment.

- Stay updated with the latest industry trends and best practices in data science, applying newfound knowledge to enhance project outcomes.

Qualifications:

- Currently pursuing any degree showcasing a strong commitment to continuous learning and professional growth.

- Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, vital for effective collaboration and articulation of complex ideas.

- Demonstrated ability to work both independently and as part of a cohesive team, highlighting adaptability and strong teamwork capabilities.

Note:

This position is unpaid. After submitting your application, our team will contact you to proceed with the application details and joining process. You can write to us on arati.chauhan@oeson.in

Location:

REMOTE, MANITOBA,CANADA

Role Overview

Do you have a passion for the creation and management of stand-out events? Are you someone who would love to travel across different cities to educate the youth on important issues? Proof Experiences is looking for a co-op/intern student to join our team as an intern for our Educational Marketing department!

This position requires for you to be both on-site and in-office working, overseeing, and assisting with the successful execution of a variety of virtual and in person educational programs targeted towards the youth all over Canada. A large portion of this internship will include travelling as a Tour Leader for educational programs that may span across the country, helping lead a team of brand ambassadors successfully promote positive messages throughout schools and busy areas.

Working with Proof Experiences will provide you with a well-rounded understanding of program management and experiential event marketing in a fast-paced environment: motivated, self-starters thrive in this industry!

What you’ll do:

• Work with various in-office teams as assigned on program logistics e.g. Assisting with execution of activity, moderation of presentations, tour management, sourcing based on specified budgets

• Provide onsite support for events to assist with onsite responsibilities as well as virtual tech support.

• Travel as a Tour Leader to educational activations, acting as front-line program representative and liaison in-field

• Assist with program set-up, event execution, tear-down and post-event reporting

• General office administration such as assisting with the scheduling, note-taking, and note distribution for client planning meetings as required

• Assist in program meetings, strategic planning, event execution and reporting

• Collaborate with senior team members and work independently

• Flexibility to travel locally as required

Who you are:

• Asset for you to be fluent in French and English

• You are prepared for local travel and some weekend work

• You are a people person!

• You have great project management and relationship building skills

• You are comfortable working with the youth and schools across Canada

• You have an ability to manage a multitude of tasks, deadlines and clients

• You are detail-oriented and take pride in the presentation and accuracy of your work

• You are resourceful / problem solver

• You are well organized, detail oriented and proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Power Point & Outlook)

• You are responsible for program outreach and tour management

• You show strong communication skills; both oral and written

• You have an ability to work in a collaborative work environment through enthusiasm, support and open communication

• You embody and respect our values of excellence, collaboration, integrity, commitment, empathy and trust!

What you’ve done:

The successful candidate will possess the following qualifications:

• Currently enrolled or recently graduated hospitality, marketing, event management program or post-graduate program

• Posess an Ontario G-class drivers license. Asset to be over 21 to rent vehicles

Salary and Requirements:

This position runs for 4 months, from January to April (can be adjusted slightly). You are expected to work 40+ hours/ week (hours will vary dependent on program needs) and will be paid a salary of $800/week.

About Proof Experiences:

Proof Experiences is committed to designing and executing insights-led and measurement-based brand experiences that deliver results. We strongly believe our people are the drivers of our success and we work hard every day to create an inspiring and engaging work culture. We have a reputation for fostering professional development, collaboration and pride in everything we do.

Proof Experiences is an equal opportunity employer dedicated to equity, diversity and inclusion in the workplace and encourages applications from all qualified applicants. If you require any accommodation during the recruitment process, please reach out to us.

Rockwell Automation is a global technology leader focused on helping the world’s manufacturers be more productive, sustainable, and agile. With more than 28,000 employees who make the world better every day, we know we have something special. Behind our customers - amazing companies that help feed the world, provide life-saving medicine on a global scale, and focus on clean water and green mobility - our people are energized problem solvers that take pride in how the work we do changes the world for the better.

We welcome all makers, forward thinkers, and problem solvers who are looking for a place to do their best work. And if that’s you we would love to have you join us!

Job Description

Job Description

Role Intern

Mode of Work Hybrid

Work location Noida

Stipend INR 30,000 only

Job Description Summary

College student performing work in project-oriented position related to your academic programme in Engineering.

Control Systems Engineer Intern for industrial automation projects based on PLC, DCS and HMI design and programming. You will work under the direction of an experienced lead / senior engineer in the design, specification, programming, simulation, and testing, of control and electrical systems. The Control Systems Engineer Intern will be involved in all stages of a project, from its design and conception through its development and commissioning support.

Job Assignment
• Control system design and programming
• Control panel design
• Development of Bill of Material (BOM)
• PLC / DCS programming
• HMI programming
• Communication network design
• System documentation and manual creation
• Documentation and testing new software applications.
• Assess new application ideas

Skills, Experience And Education (SKEE)
• Pursuing Full time bachelor's degree (preferably in 7th or 8th Sem) in Core engineering branches like Electrical / Instrumentation & Control / Electronics & Communication.
• Good knowledge of core subjects with basic knowledge of programming languages e.g. C, C++ etc.

Benefits

The ability to collaborate with, learn from colleagues in a complex, global organization.

We provide a working environment with a creative company, paired with a great compensation package, great benefits, and a supportive atmosphere where you can sharpen with new challenges and development opportunities.

Hybrid work-from-home and at a determined Rockwell Automation facility.

Corporate Social Responsibility opportunities,

Support from our 24/7 employee assistance program.

Reporting will to Technical Lead.

Primary work location Noida, India.

We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

At Rockwell Automation we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right person for this or other roles.

Rockwell Automation’s hybrid policy aligns that employees are expected to work at a Rockwell location at least Mondays, Tuesdays, and Thursdays unless they have a business obligation out of the office.

Human Resources Internship

Do you like to jump in and 'get the job done'? Tasks may include processing applicants, onboarding, tracking projects, processing contracts and more, all while keeping everything organized through the discipline of project management.

Are you interested in turning our vision into reality? All of these projects are well-formed and just need a go-getter to 'make them happen'.

General Purpose: Preparation of materials and completion of specific projects while ensuring consistency with company strategy, commitments and goals. The intern will learn best practices in recruiting, human resources management, interviewing and general project management from experienced staff.

Once your application is received and reviewed, we will be in contact with you, and you may start immediately! Overall, you would get lots of experience in music industry work, e.g., performances and other promotional activity for any number of our artists. The sky's the limit -- let us know what you would like to learn -- it ALL needs to get done!

REQUIREMENTS

Some of the tasks that you might get to do while working on your project may include:
• Recruiting
• Human resources management
• Interviewing
• Manage projects and help coordinate staff
• Assign and monitor work progress
• Outreach to prospective recruits
• Understanding all relevant guidelines and industry requirements
• Planning group activities and/or meetings
• Organizing deliverables and coordinating team members
• Writing, editing, and sending out communications, project tracking sheets, etc.
• Keeping all constituents informed and up-to-date on all activities
• Conducting research and/or reviewing materials to understand various tools, systems and processes
• Developing Standard Operating Procedures based on current and new methodologies
• Database updates
• Conduct pre- and post-evaluations and report on outcomes

Candidate should possess:
• Currently enrolled in College or University in the fields of human resources, project/product management, English or related fields
• Strong organizational skills
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office, basic database knowledge
• Knowledge of project management techniques and tools

Candidates should have the following key competencies:
• Critical thinking and problem-solving skills
• Planning and organizing
• Attention to detail
• Decision-making
• Communication skills
• Teamwork
• Adaptability
• Writing, proofreading and editing

Please note:
• This training is similar to that which is provided in a vocational school
• This training is for the benefit of you personally, to develop your skills, resume, etc.
• Your training supervisor will ensure that the activities you work on benefit you while you are being trained
• This position is only for learning purposes and does not displace any employees in this company; additionally, it is not an opportunity to become an employee of this company
• This is an UNPAID internship to support the individual in obtaining a university/college credit

Job Type: Internship

Benefits:
• Casual dress
• Flexible schedule
• Work from home

COVID-19 considerations: The majority is remote work. When in-person, it is at your option, and COVID guidelines are in place.

COVID-19 precaution(s):
• Remote interview process
• Virtual meetings

Location: Canada_Remote, Canada

Dans des marchés en rapide évolution, les clients à travers le monde font confiance à Thales. Thales est une entreprise où les personnes les plus brillantes du monde entier se regroupent pour mettre en commun leurs idées et ainsi s'inspirer mutuellement. Dans tous les secteurs où œuvre Thales, notamment l’aérospatiale, le transport, la défense, la sécurité et l'espace, nos équipes d’architectes conçoivent des solutions innovantes qui rendent demain possible dès aujourd’hui.

In fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. In aerospace, transportation, defence, security and space, our architects design innovative solutions that make our tomorrow's possible.

This position is Remote Canada

Engineering Community Intern

Position Summary

Thales Corporate Engineering in the Americas is looking for an intern/apprentice to support the Engineering communities. You will support the Engineering Director to build an Engineering community across the Americas that is greater than the sum of its parts. This will be done by connecting with the broader Thales Engineering community, supporting the organization of collaborative events, expanding the use of digital and non-digital communication and helping building operational dashboards to support regional activities.

Key Areas of Responsibility

If you are interested in building communities, Engineering and digital culture you can help the Americas Engineering Director by:
• Helping with seminars and webinars to create a sense of belonging of the Engineering community;
• Helping spread awareness about Engineering craftsmanship, digital culture, learning in Engineering by connecting to the greater Thales and through digital tools such as SharePoint;
• Finding and helping create engaging digital content on Engineering in the Americas leveraging on what exists at group level, and also in the industry in the Americas;
• Researching and analyzing ideas from external Digital Transformation and Engineering events and proposing ways in which Thales can benefit from them;
• Work closely with the entire Digital Communication team to share expertise, develop joint projects, and propose the best interfacing between the Digital Communication services;
• Support the digitization of data for Engineering and the build the dashboard that will help the decisions makers.

Minimum Requirements
• You are in your last year of study in a Business School or Engineering school with a strong interest for communication or equivalent;
• You have a high interest in Engineering and Digital transformation;
• You are fluent in English and have knowledge of French and Spanish;
• You have knowledge in data analysis and visualization using tools such as PowerBI;

Preferred Qualifications
• You have a degree in Engineering
• You are fluent in French and Spanish
• You have knowledge of Brazilian

What We Offer

Thales provides an extensive benefits program for all full-time employees working 24 or more hours per week and their eligible dependents, including the following:
• Company paid Extended Health, Dental, HSA, Life, AD&D, Short-term Disability, Cancer Care Program, travel insurance, Employee Assistance Plan and Well-Being program.
• Retirement Savings Plans (RRSP, DCPP, TFSA) with a company contribution and a match to a DCPP, with no vesting period.
• Company paid holidays, vacation days, and paid sick leave.
• Voluntary Life, AD&D, Critical Illness, Long-Term Disability.
• Employee Discounts on home, auto, and gym membership.

Why Join Us?

Sa Say HI and learn more about working at Thales click here.

(https://youtu.be/9aMF4NMhEJo)

#hybrid

Thales est un employeur offrant l’égalité des chances qui valorise la diversité et l’inclusion sur le lieu de travail. Thales s’engage à mettre en place des mesures d’adaptation tout au long du processus de recrutement. Les candidats sélectionnés pour une entrevue et ayant besoin de mesures d’adaptation sont priés de le faire savoir lors de l’invitation à l’entrevue; notre équipe travaillera volontiers avec chaque candidat pour répondre à ses besoins particuliers. Tous les renseignements relatifs aux mesures d’adaptation seront traités d’une manière confidentielle et utilisés uniquement dans le but d’offrir une expérience candidat adaptée.

Thales is an equal opportunity employer which values diversity and inclusivity in the workplace. Thales is committed to providing accommodations in all parts of the interview process. Applicants selected for an interview who require accommodation are asked to advise accordingly upon the invitation for an interview. We will work with you to meet your needs. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

Mechanical Co-op Student - ( 240004BL )

Description

Stantec Buildings is on a mission to become the world’s leading integrated design practice. Our architects, engineers, interior designers, sustainability specialists, and technologists are passionate about the power of design. We take an innovative, collaborative approach to projects, sharing a common belief that sustainable design for the built environment can make the world a better place for future generations. Join us and design your place with Stantec.

Your Opportunity

We have an opportunity for an Intern Mechanical Engineer (4 Month Term) to join our St. John’s Buildings group starting January 2024.

Your Key Responsibilities
• Prepare contract drawings, schematics, schedules, details, and sketches from conceptual design through to construction.
• Assist in the design of building related mechanical systems including HVAC, Plumbing and Fire Protection systems across Canada using applicable codes, standards, and reference materials.
• Review equipment selections, perform preliminary engineering calculations, and develop preliminary designs.
• Facilitate and ensure the quality of the project deliverables.
• Follow production guidelines and project standards.
• Review shop drawings and other contractor submittals for compliance with construction documents.
• Perform field surveys for drawing developments, site reviews and as recorded drawings.
• Communicate with other team members and become familiar with Stantec standards. To complete assignments and projects in a timely manner as required by the supervisor.

Qualifications

Your Capabilities and Credentials
• Knowledge or familiarity using Autodesk Revit® and AutoCAD software in drafting and design of buildings related projects would be an asset.
• Knowledge or experience with building mechanical systems would be an asset.
• Prior experience in the construction industry would be an asset.
• Knowledge or familiarity with National Building Codes, plumbing codes, fire codes, and energy codes would be considered an asset.
• Knowledge or familiarity with LEED standards, ASHRAE, ASPE and NFPA would be considered an asset.
• Excellent verbal and written skills to communicate effectively with colleagues and staff; a “team player” approach.
• Self-motivated and self-starter with a strong work ethic.
• Good time management skills and able to work in a fast-paced work environment.
• Eager to learn with strong listening and critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

Education And Experience
• Working towards a degree as a Mechanical Engineer from a reputable Canadian University and successful completion of Academic Term 5 as of January 2024 and is available for a 4-month internship.

Typical office environment working with computers. Field work may include exposure to the elements including inclement weather.

This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.

Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other’s talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best. #DesignYourPlace

Benefits Summary: Regular full-time and part-time employees will have access to health, dental, and vision plans, a well-being program, health care spending account, wellness spending accounts, group registered retirement savings plan, employee stock purchase program, group tax-free savings account, life and accidental death & dismemberment (AD&D) insurance, short-term/long-term disability plans, emergency travel benefits, tuition reimbursement, professional membership fee coverage, and paid time off.

Temporary/casual employees will have access to group registered retirement savings plan, employee stock purchase program, and group tax-free savings account.

The benefits information listed above may not apply to union positions because benefits for such positions are governed by applicable collective bargaining agreements.

Primary Location : Canada-Newfoundland and Labrador-St. John's

Organization : BC-1334 Buildings-CA Atlantic Canada

Employee Status : Temporary

Job Level : Entry Level

Travel : No

Schedule : Part-time

Job Posting : Nov 28, 2024, 7:32:59 AM

Req ID: 240004BL

Stantec provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants for future and current employment and prohibit discrimination on the grounds of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression. We prohibit discrimination in decisions concerning recruitment, hiring, referral, promotion, compensation, fringe benefits, job training, terminations or any other condition of employment. Stantec is in compliance with local, state and federal laws and regulations and ensures equitable opportunities in all aspects of employment. EEO including Disability/Protected Veterans

data.job_title: Software/Data Engineering Intern (4-12 months starting Winter 2025)
data.job_description:
Apply on the Verdi careers page: https://verdiag.applytojobs.ca/

What we do

Long term: We empower farmers to build a more resilient future for global agriculture.

Right now: We build modern irrigation automation for every grower. We do that by building and deploying intelligent devices to automate farm infrastructure for irrigation, fertilization, and other operations along with the software to scalably manage it all.

You might think this is surely a solved problem. It turns out it isn’t. Especially not at the scale our customers, the world’s largest food brands, operate at. And that’s where you come in.

Where you come in

As an intern on the Software and Data team, you’ll help us work towards our mission while developing yourself technically and professionally.

You will:
• Join a small team of passionate people enabling 21st century agriculture
• Have an opportunity to make an impact at an early stage startup as it scales up
• Help our growers feel confident in our systems and manage the complexities of their operations
• Write high-quality code, develop processes, work with evolving designs, and contribute in whatever ways you can to our mission

What your time here will look like

We approach our internships with lots of flexibility in order to adapt your relatively short time here to what you’re good at and what you’d like to get better at.

Being a fairly small team, we’ll need your help to ensure you get the most of your time here. We’ll work together to figure out what style of internship works best for you. You can spend your time working as any other member of the team within our regular development process or take ownership over a larger, more contained project.

Regardless of how we structure your internship, you’ll be able to work on the following areas:
• Front-end engineering on the Verdi Dashboard used by all our customers to control and monitor their systems
• Back-end engineering to improve or expand APIs and system architecture
• Device communication architecture used to handle communication with our fleet of Verdi and third-party devices
• Cloud infrastructure and DevOps to improve how we build, deploy, and maintain our systems
• Data Analysis and Machine Learning explorations/systems/features to help make use of our data and provide value to customers
• Documentation and process improvements
• Anything else you could reasonably improve during your internship

You’ll also be expected to:
• Write code that is extensible, well-documented, and readable
• Collaborate with people from relevant teams including Hardware, Design, and Business
• Manage any internship requirements with your school in a timely manner
• Participate in project management processes
• Communicate your work with the wider team

Finally, we’ll have regular check-ins to make sure you’re progressing well and have dedicated opportunities for mentorship.

Our stack
• Cloud host
• Google Cloud Platform
• Database
• MongoDB
• TimescaleDB (PostgreSQL-based)
• Back-end
• TypeScript
• NodeJS
• Mongoose/Typegoose
• Jest
• Prisma
• Front-end
• Typescript
• PixiJS
• Material UI
• Leaflet
• Device communication
• LoRaWAN
• The Things Industries
• DevOps
• Terraform
• Docker

What we’re looking for

You are:
• Enthusiastic about software and data
• Eager to learn on your own and from others
• Able to write code in a software engineering context with some knowledge of best practices
• Open-minded and receptive to feedback
• Detailed and thoughtful in everything you create
• Communicative and someone who asks questions

You must:
• Be enrolled in a relevant technical program at a University or College
• Graduate from your program in 1-2 years
• Be able to work in Vancouver, BC for the duration of the internship
• Hold Canadian citizenship, Permanent Residency or refugee status (International students are not eligible)

What we’re excited by
• Familiarity with our stack
• Interest and/or experience in the agriculture/sustainability industry
• Past internships/experience doing software/data work, especially in startups
• Personal or school projects that demonstrate strong technical and creative abilities

What you get
• Flexible hybrid work style (generally in office M-W-F)
• Flexible work hours (generally available 11am to 5pm)
• Flexibility to work remotely as needed
• Hourly wage of $25-40/hour paid as 8 hours/day (no time-logging)
• Vacation pay of 4% of days worked (time off is unpaid)
• Unlimited paid sick days
• A pretty cool office located at 2285 Clark Dr.
• Opportunity to work in one of the world’s most livable cities with unmatched access to nature and activities
• Chance to make an impact on a fast-growing startup and the agriculture industry
• Chance to travel to interesting locations to meet with growers

Job Description

The Opportunity:

WSP is currently seeking Co-op Students to join our Regional Roads team, located Red Deer or Calgary. Reporting to the Area Manager, this position will be responsible for supporting projects primarily in the field and office as well.
• Expected start date : May 2025
• Duration: 4-months & 8-months
• Application Instructions: Please indicate your duration (4 months / 8 months) on your application

Why choose WSP?
• We value and are committed to upholding a culture of inclusion and belonging
• Our Flexible Work Policy – we recognize the importance of balance in our lives and encourage you to prioritize the balance in yours. We will support you on and off the job so you can be fully present in both your work and home lives.
• A Canadian success story - we're proud to wear the red and white of this beautiful country and show the world what Canada has to offer.
• Enhance the world around you - from the environment to the highways, to the buildings and the terrain, WSP is the fabric of Canada.
• Outstanding career opportunities - we're growing and pushing ourselves every day to be greater than yesterday - we're open to your ideas and trying new things.
• A phenomenal collaborative culture and a workforce filled with genuinely good people who are doing humbly important work. Come find out for yourself what it's like to be a part of our journey.

We offer attractive pay, flexible work options, a great corporate culture, comprehensive and employee-focused benefits including virtual healthcare and a wellness platform as well as great savings programs, and a clear vision for the future.

#WeAreWSP #StudentTech-CA

What you can expect to do here:
• To work with Project Managers, Technicians and Surveyors on the delivery of a variety of complex transportation engineering projects;
• Travel to various projects throughout the assigned region to ensure required tasks are completed in a timely manner and construction schedules are not compromised;
• Perform various material testing in accordance with procedures outlined in Contract Specifications, CSA and ASTM;
• Assist and/or perform various surveys on various projects throughout the assigned region as required and outlined in Contract Specifications;
• Support the engineering team with onsite construction surveying using GPS, Drone and conventional survey methods;
• Prepare laboratory test reports, and field review reports;
• Ability and willingness to travel, work away from home for extended periods of time, and work long hours;
• Other duties as assigned.

What you’ll bring to WSP:
• Have a valid Class 5 driver’s license;
• Currently enrolled in an accredited co-op post-secondary Civil Engineering program;
• Adaptable to a changing work environment;
• Motivated, self-starter who can be a leader and work well independently or with a team;
• Excellent communication, both written and verbal.

About Us

WSP is one of the world's leading professional services firms. Our purpose is to future proof our cities and environments.

We have over 65,000 team members across the globe. In Canada, our 12,000+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transportation networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future.

At WSP:
• We value our people and our reputation
• We are locally dedicated with international scale
• We are future focused and challenge the status quo
• We foster collaboration in everything we do
• We have an empowering culture and hold ourselves accountable

Please Note:

Health and Safety is a core paramount value of WSP. Given the importance of keeping one another safe it is expected that you comply with our Health, Safety & Environment (HSE) policy at all times as well as client HSE policies when working at client locations.

Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits).

WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.

WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. For more information please READ THE FULL POLICY.

Objectif du poste

Vous désirez contribuer à l’essor de l’électrification des transports?

Joignez-vous à nous dans le développement et l’avancement de technologies propres, efficientes et efficaces et contribuez à la croissance de l’électrification des transports.

Dana TM4 est une entreprise dont la mission première est l’électrification des transports. Nous sommes reconnus dans le monde entier pour nos produits de haute technologie. Nous sommes une entreprise québécoise dynamique et en pleine croissance qui encourage la créativité et l’innovation. Nous croyons que les défis sont intéressants et constamment renouvelés et que nous pouvons tous faire une différence personnelle.
En tant que membre actif de l’équipe de test, de Validation et de Vérification des produits, vous travaillerez avec les équipes de développement, de validation et de mise sur le marché des produits. En tant que stagiaire en gestion de projet de Vérification et Validation, vous assisterez les gestionnaires de projet V&V et l’équipe de validation et de test pour valider nos produits qui seront installer dans les véhicules électriques de demain. Vous participerez à la définition, à l’exécution et à la mise en oeuvre des stratégies de test de nos systèmes de propulsion électrique pour les véhicules électriques de demain.

Tâches et responsabilités du poste

Vos défis
• Être responsable de la préparation, la coordination, du suivi et de la production de rapports d’avancement de projet de validation de produit afin de respecter le calendrier des clients.
• Suivre et assurer la livraison des intrants nécessaires à la validation.
• Soutenir le planificateur de laboratoire pour maximiser l’efficacité du laboratoire.
• Soutenir le coordonnateur de laboratoire pour maintenir à jour les outils de suivi du matériel de laboratoire.
• Maintenir et mettre à jour les DVP&R (Design Validation Plan & Reports).
• Proposer et mettre en place des initiatives d’améliorations continues visant les processus de validation et d’essais du laboratoire.
• Participer à la mise à jour du catalogue de standard de test du laboratoire.

Vos forces
• 2e ou 3e année de baccalauréat en génie mécanique, logiciel, électrique ou expérience équivalente pertinente
• Essentiel : Proactivité et aise à travailler dans un environnement dynamique
• Essentiel : Curieux, autonome, leadership
• Essentiel : Expérience démontrée avec les outils MS Office
• Atout : Expérience en gestion de projet
• Atout : Expérience sur les outils Atlassian (Jira, Confluence)
• Atout : Expérience en test et validation
• Atout : connaissances en langage de programmation
• Habileté en communication et vulgarisation
• Habileté à documenter son travail
• Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais (parlé et écrit)

The Opportunity

Olympic Industries is excited to offer a highly motivated and detail-orientated student the opportunity to join our growth-oriented team for a 4-month contract beginning in January 2025 as an Accounting Intern!

Working closely with the Operations Department, the Accounting Intern will gain valuable hands-on experience in various aspects of accounting including invoicing, and month-end closing procedures. This internship will also provide an opportunity to develop your administrative skills while working in a supportive and collaborative office environment.

Specific Responsibilities

As an Accounting Intern your responsibilities may include, but are not limited to, the following responsibilities:

Support the Invoicing Team in managing the creation, processing, and distribution of invoices:
• Support the Invoicing Team in managing the creation, processing, and distribution of invoices.
• Resolving inquiries, including issuing debits & credits to resolve discrepancies, and answering invoicing-related questions.
• Update and adjust sales orders per approval.
• Complete required customs paperwork.
• Perform basic office duties such as filing, scanning, and organizing documents.
• Assist in the month-end closing procedures.
• Participation in ad hoc projects.

Who We’re Looking For

Education and Experience
• Working towards a Diploma or Degree in a related program such as Accounting.
• Previous experience in a fast-paced work environment.
• Proficient in Microsoft applications, particularly Microsoft Excel.
• Experience with AS400 and Great Plains considered an asset.

What We Offer

Small Company with Big Perks
• Olympic is a mid-sized company with an open door/open concept layout where anybody you may need is easily accessible. This layout not only helps to support individuals in their career growth and development but also encourages individuals to interact and be curious about how different departments support each other in their roles.

Great Central Location
• Located in the Lonsdale Quay, Olympic is transit accessible from any location in the lower mainland. There are many great shops, restaurants, and parks within a walking distance and the mountains are just a 10-minute drive away.

Additional Details
• Salary range: $38,000-$45,000 per annum.
• This position is 100% in office, located in Lower Lonsdale, North Vancouver.

Apply Now!

For more information on Olympic Industries, please visit our website at www.olympicind.com .

We thank all applicants for their interest! However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. At Olympic Industries, we embrace diversity and are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, cultures, perspectives skills, and experiences. As an equal opportunity employer, we encourage applications from all qualified individuals.

Lanescape is a specialized architecture practice specializing in the development of laneway and garden suites throughout Toronto. As key proponents in the development of Toronto’s Changing Lanes by-law and the recently approved garden suite policy, our office operates at the intersection of social advocacy, urban planning and contextually-sensitive design. As we continue to pioneer Toronto’s accessory dwelling unit initiatives, our work is fundamentally unique and innovative. We specialize in creative, high-performance design and construction from preliminary site planning through to a granular level of detail. Our practice is located in downtown Toronto, with projects throughout the urban core and its periphery.

With a rapidly growing project list, we are seeking a passionate and technically proficient individual to join our team. Key responsibilities include but are not limited to; preparation of drawings for permit, tender and construction in Revit, consultant coordination, development and maintenance of office standards, and assisting with product research and specifications. The successful candidate will be a well-organized, detail-oriented individual capable of working on several projects simultaneously.

Qualifications
• Minimum 3 years experience in single family residential design and construction
• Proficiency in the following software:
• High proficiency in Autodesk Revit is essential
• Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop)
• Sketchup
• Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel)
• Thorough comprehension of wood-frame construction detailing, materials, and standards
• Knowledge of the Ontario Building Code, Part 9
• Familiarity with municipal approvals and the Toronto zoning by-law
• Passion for sustainable, innovative urban design and construction
• Self-sufficiency, self-motivation and a critical eye for detail
• Excellent graphic, written and oral communication skills

Responsibilities
• Full-time work week from our office, 9am-5pm, Monday-Friday.
• Collaborate and coordinate with teammates, clients, consultants, and vendors
• Lead preparation of drawings for permit, tender, and construction
• Material/specification research, detailing, and coordination
• Monitoring of deliverables, schedules and communication with clients

Compensation

Commensurate with experience - $50,000 - $60,000

Application

To apply, please email the following to info@lanescape.ca in PDF format:
• Cover Letter
• Current Résumé/CV
• Portfolio of relevant work

Job Number: 70488
Group: Magna Exteriors
Division: Plastcoat
Job Type: Student
Location: BRAMPTON

Work Style:
About us

We see a future where everyone can live and move without limitations. That's why we are developing technologies, systems and concepts that make vehicles safer and cleaner, while serving our communities, the planet and, above all, people.

Forward. For all.

Group Summary

The Magna Exteriors portfolio of products includes access systems such as liftgates, exterior trim, modular systems, front-end modules including fascia, active aerodynamic systems and other lightweight structural components for automotive, commercial truck and other industrial markets.

Recognized globally as an innovator in all aspects of vehicle exteriors, Magna provides everything needed, from materials development and design through manufacturing and assembly, to help automakers create sleek, state-of-the-art vehicles across the world.

About the Role
• Strong verbal and written communication skills
• Advanced Excel skills and proficiency with Microsoft Word
• Demonstrated ability to effectively solve problems
• Strong interpersonal skills
• Reliability, accuracy and thoroughness
• Well-developed organizational and time management skills
• Ability to establish priorities, meet deadlines and work in fast paced environment

Your Responsibilities
• Review eRFX system and supplier CQI assessments to determine which suppliers have expired CQI assessments
• For suppliers missing a valid CQI assessment:
• contact supplier by phone and by email to solicit CQI assessment
• follow up frequently (daily basis) with supplier on status of CQI assessment
• review submitted CQI assessment to confirm it is duly completed; verify assessment dates entered within eRFX and within electronic document are correct
• As required, contact suppliers by phone and email to ensure supplier contact info within eRFX is updated and accurate
• Consult with Plastcoat Quality Engineers and Supplier Quality Engineer for any concerns related to supplier CQI assessments
• Update/refresh supplier CQI PowerBI dashboard on a weekly basis
• Initiate customer satisfaction QPF complaints (as required) for those suppliers who do not submit CQI assessment
• Follow up with the issued QPF complaints on a weekly basis
• Digitize hardcopy PPAP records and arrange to have them

Job Title: Co-Op, People Team & Operations (Winter 2025 Term)

Location: Vancouver, BC

Term: 4 months

Start Date: January 20, 2025

Openings: 1

Overview:

Our People team is looking for a motivated and proactive co-op student to join us for the Winter 2025 term and assist in various functions including (but not limited to) Total Rewards, People Operations, Benefits, Talent Acquisition and Learning & Development. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, learning and contributing to various HR functions while developing their skills.

Responsibilities (could include but are not limited to):
• Providing support to the Total Rewards team in administering employee compensation and benefits programs, including data entry, record-keeping, and communication with employees and vendors.
• Prepare employment-related documentation to support the changes that take place throughout the employee lifecycle
• Assisting the Benefits team with employee benefits programs, including health, dental, vision, disability and life insurance.
• Support the Talent Acquisition team with candidate sourcing, screening, scheduling and communication, as well as maintaining applicant tracking systems and candidate data.
• Assist in the administration of various Learning & Development initiatives including coordinating training sessions, managing participant attendance and materials, and tracking participant progress.
• Assist in the administration of various Learning & Development initiatives including administering the LMS, coordinating training sessions, managing participant attendance and materials, and tracking participant progress
• Assist the Social Impact and Diversity, Equity and Inclusion teams in the areas of events, partnerships (internal & external) and communications.
• Collaborate with People team members to continuously improve People team processes and procedures, including documentation, communication and reporting.
• Participate in the facilitation, coordination & delivery of an HR centric project.

Requirements:
• Currently enrolled in a relevant post-Grad, Bachelor's or Master's program, preferably in Human Resources or a related field.
• Strong attention to detail, organization and time management skills.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Ability to work effectively in a team environment, as well as independently.
• Proficient in Google suite, particularly Sheets and Decks.
• Demonstrated interest in Human Resources and eagerness to learn.

Learning opportunities in this role:
• Gain hands-on experience in various People functions including Total Rewards, Benefits, Talent Acquisition and Learning & Development.
• Develop and enhance HR knowledge and skills.
• Opportunity to work with a dynamic and collaborative People team.
• Potential for future employment opportunities upon completion of the co-op term.

WHO YOU ARE:
• Tenacious. You are determined to succeed, and you are motivated by the success of customers, colleagues and the community.
• Curious. You are always learning and seeking ways to make things better.
• Conscientious. You keep your promises, taking your commitments to others seriously, and you have strong integrity.
• Humble. You lead with humility and empathy, respecting and learning from the perspectives of others.

In all we do, our six guiding principles light the way:

Step Up: Show the world what it looks like to live and work by these guiding principles. #StepUp

One Team: Make Hootsuite a place where everyone feels safe, welcome, valued, and empowered to do their best work without compromising who they are. #OneTeam #FreeToBeMe

Customer Obsessed: Focus relentlessly on helping our customers succeed. #CustomerObsessed

Go Fast, Be Agile: Widen our competitive advantage by committing to speed and simplicity over perfection and complexity. #GoFastBeAgile

Play to Win: Commit to building an incredible, profitable company for our customers, our employees, and our stakeholders. #PlayToWin #NoExcuses

Neighbours & Allies: Give back to our communities and be an ally. #SocialForGood #Allies

We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from all qualified candidates. If you are interested in this exciting opportunity, please submit your resume and cover letter for consideration.

Accommodations will be provided as requested by candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

#LI-YF

data.job_description:
Job Description

Please refer to hiring department

QUALIFICATIONS:Education, Training And Experience

Please refer to hiring department.

Skills And Abilities

Please refer to hiring department.

Link To Full Job Description

https://jd.viha.ca/JD3077.pdf

Water / Wastewater Student Intern - ( 240004CI )

Description

Many of the world’s top engineers and scientists come together in our Water business because they view a community’s interaction with water a bit differently—as a single holistic system, rather than unconnected networks divided by jurisdictional boundaries. Working throughout the hydrologic cycle, we are delivering sustainable solutions to make sure water is where it should be and available when needed. Our experts guide our work with scientific rigor, an innovative spirit, and a vision for growth. Every day, we help communities improve, reuse, and protect this precious resource for future generations. By 2025 we’re hiring 2,000 people (like you) to join our team. Grow with us, H2O+U..

Your Opportunity

As a Student Intern, you will work in a team environment and have exposure to water infrastructure projects which may include water and wastewater plants, lagoons, pump stations, water supply and distribution and sewer collection systems. This is a terrific opportunity for a university or college student to support a number of exciting local and national projects. This is a contract position with a duration running from May 2025 to November 2025.

Your Key Responsibilities

Provide onsite contract administration including completion of the following tasks:
• Maintain and operate survey equipment and assist on a survey field crew.
• Attend construction sites to observe and monitor construction progress, report on deficiencies and complete construction progress reports as well as, pick up as-built information for records drawings.
• Attend project sites for the purposes of obtaining samples, arranging sample testing and compiling and interpreting results.
• Assisting in project administration including writing reports, gathering information, drafting correspondence, tracking project costs, and completing progress reports
• Assisting technical staff with various project tasks, including researching, compiling and evaluating project data, preparing reports and performing calculations for water and wastewater treatment projects and/or sewer or watermain design projects.
• Performing simple calculations, computer data entry, along with some exposure to CAD, design and cross-training.
• Complete other engineering/administrative duties as required.

Qualifications

Your Capabilities and Credentials
• Proficient with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
• Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.
• Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and take direction.
• Knowledge of state and federal regulations, policies, and programs, are a plus.
• Proven ability to learn and take direction
• Valid driver’s license and vehicle required
• Physically able to work on construction sites in all types of weather conditions

Education and Experience
• In progress toward earning a Bachelor's degree or Diploma in civil, water resources or environmental engineering from an accredited University or College.
• Successful completion of 1 st year Civil Technology or Civil Engineering courses as a minimum.

Field work may include exposure to the elements including inclement weather. Limited office working environment is expected for this role, however if in the office it would include working at a desk for long periods of time.

This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.

Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other’s talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best.

Benefits Summary: Regular full-time and part-time employees will have access to health, dental, and vision plans, a well-being program, health care spending account, wellness spending accounts, group registered retirement savings plan, employee stock purchase program, group tax-free savings account, life and accidental death & dismemberment (AD&D) insurance, short-term/long-term disability plans, emergency travel benefits, tuition reimbursement, professional membership fee coverage, and paid time off.

Temporary/casual employees will have access to group registered retirement savings plan, employee stock purchase program, and group tax-free savings account.

The benefits information listed above may not apply to union positions because benefits for such positions are governed by applicable collective bargaining agreements.

Organization : BC-1112 Water-CA Prairies & Territories

Employee Status : Temporary

Job Level : Entry Level

Travel : Yes, 10 % of the Time

Schedule : Full-time

Job Posting : Nov 28, 2024, 7:51:23 AM

We prohibit discrimination in decisions concerning recruitment, hiring, referral, promotion, compensation, fringe benefits, job training, terminations or any other condition of employment.
