About Panevo

At Panevo we combine our passion for sustainability and engineering to enable industry to optimize utility and process performance, reduce costs and ensure environmental compliance. From strategy, to site auditing, to project implementation, we deliver long-term benefit to local businesses and global brands.

About this opportunity

Panevo’s ioTORQ software platform is used by worldclass manufacturers to manage utility usage, reduce cost & emissions, support corporate sustainability reporting and improve production efficiency. Panevo are expanding into Brazil and are seeking to secure local partners, integrators and innovation partners.

For more information, please refer to:
• www.panevo.com/emis
• www.panevo.com/ubm
• www.panevo.com/lean

Key responsibilities include:
• Perform Brazil market research and determine the potential for local ioTORQ software sales.
• Perform SWOT and PEST analysis relevant to the local market.
• Screen and interview potential Value Added Resellers (VARs).
• Prioritize potential partners and present to internal management team.
• Support software demonstrations, partnering negotiations and contracting.
• Attend local tradeshows as required (expenses paid).
• Manage sales and administrative processes in-line with Panevo’s systems.
• Primary sector focus: Industrial, transport, large commercial, healthcare, municipalities.
• Success metrics: Identifying and securing local partner(s).

Location

We have offices in Vancouver and Toronto, so the candidate can choose one of these two locations. We have a flexible work environment with work from home and the office.

Key attributes and skills
• Currently enrolled or recent graduate from an engineering or business program.
• Proficient in Portuguese
• Interested in technical sales and B2B software applications

Our offer

This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in a growing, creative and results-oriented business.

How to apply

Please submit your resume and cover letter via Indeed. Candidates of interest will typically be contacted within two weeks of applying.

Panevo is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our policy is to provide a fair and equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants regardless of factors such as race, color, age, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

www.panevo.com

Core skills & sector focus keywords

Software as a Service, B2B sales, marketing, business development, Industrial energy management, utility reduction, resource conservation, lean manufacturing

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: $3,100.00-$3,900.00 per month

Benefits:
• Casual dress
• Company events
• Paid time off
• Work from home

Flexible language requirement:
• French not required

Schedule:
• Monday to Friday

Application question(s):
• Will you be able to reliably commute or relocate to Vancouver or Toronto for this position?

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Vancouver, BC V6B 3H7

Application deadline: 2024-12-08
Expected start date: 2025-01-02

People & Culture Analyst (Student)

As a member of the Invest Alberta Corporation (IAC) team, you will create connections and positively contribute to the overall employee experience at IAC by supporting the People & Culture team. Reporting to the Director of People & Culture, the People & Culture Analyst has the opportunity to explore many aspects of the human resources function, including recruitment, learning & development, and employee experience. To succeed in this role, you will bring problem-solving skills, an eye for improvement, and a growth mindset.

Primary duties will include:
• Providing support for the People & Culture department’s various functions.
• Engaging and collaborating with internal and external stakeholders to accomplish tasks such as recruitment and administrative support.
• Taking ownership of processes and projects, including rolling out policies and developing programs.
• Being a resource for employees who have questions about company policy and procedures.
• Researching solutions and analyzing the results of various initiatives, including employee engagement surveys, compensation and benefits surveys, etc.
• Developing, maintaining, and strengthening professional working relationships across the organization and its partner networks.
• Discretely handling confidential information and data – adhering to privacy and confidentiality at all times.
• Leveraging technology to improve organization, communication, and efficiency.
• Other duties as required.

Qualifications:
• Ideally, you will be a business student with a human resources or general business major, and at least second year standing in your program. Your previous experience will demonstrate your proficiency and ability in MS Office (including SharePoint, Excel, Word, etc.) and strong interpersonal communication skills.
• You possess a strong attention to detail and excellent organization and problem-solving skills. With a proven ability to successfully prioritize and execute multiple projects, you are solution-oriented and strive for continuous improvement.
• Experience working with stakeholders at all levels (both within and outside the organization) is considered an asset.
• In addition to the above, you must be able to provide proof of enrollment at a post- secondary institution to qualify for this work term.

About the Organization

Invest Alberta Corporation works directly with investors to attract high-value and high- impact investments to the province. We bring industry, government partners, and economic organizations together to offer seamless services that make it easy for investment to flow into the province. With a strong entrepreneurial culture, we are taking new and innovative approaches to investment attraction.

Our clients come from a wide variety of backgrounds, and so do we. Invest Alberta Corporation is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. In recruiting for our team, we welcome the unique contributions that you can bring in terms of your education, culture, gender, race, sexual orientation, religious or ethnic backgrounds or physical abilities.

How to apply

Interested in being a part of a new, dynamic organization that was designed to have a positive impact on Alberta’s future? If you are looking for an exciting and unique opportunity, to make a difference, and make connections, apply by including a cover letter, resume, and salary expectations.

Closing Date: December 9

Anticipated Start Date: January 2025 for an 8-month term.

Thank you for your interest in IAC. Only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. No phone calls please. To learn more about IAC & this position please visit: investalberta.ca

What are we looking for?

The Quality Engineering Co-op will be a member of our Quality team working closing to support our production team.

Co-op Term: January 2025 - April 2025

Essential Responsibilities
• Creating/Improving processes related to Return to Vendor and MRB Cage by establishing physical and systematic processes, workflows and documentation.
• Gain Oracle knowledge to establish, improve and implement new processes related to Supplier Quality.
• Create and support reporting and analysis in Oracle, such as daily status reports, return to vendor, inspections and inventory.
• Support the non-conformance process through supplier and operations follow-ups.
• Help with ad hoc incoming inspection to develop associated reporting and workflow.
• Contributing to the development and implementation of best practice warehouse strategy, processes and procedures to aid and improve operational performance.
• Developing action plans to optimize material storage processes and improve efficiency.
• Conducting audits on material storage locations to determine inventory accuracy.
• Analyzing stored data regarding material control to create both reports and spreadsheets.

Your Profile
• Experience working within a manufacturing setting would be considered.
• Proficiency in Microsoft Programs, such as PowerPoint, Word and Excel.
• Knowledge in Oracle, SAP or other ERP systems.
• Ability to multi-task and deliver key objectives within established timelines.
• Ability to work independently and within cross-functional teams.

data.employer_name: Ministère des Transports et de la Mobilité durable du Québec (MTMD)

data.job_description:
At Electronic Arts (EA), DRE (Development and Release Engineering) represents the pinnacle of continuous integration and build mastery. Composed of over 100 dedicated professionals, our global presence spans North American, European, and Asia-Pacific EA studios.

Our Commitment

We take pride in delivering exceptional automation services to our diverse clientele within EA—ranging from game and engine groups to product and content teams.

Your Opportunity

We are looking for a Coop for a 8-month contract to work alongside our DRE Mobile team. This position is open for candidates in Vancouver, Canada, or those preferring a remote/hybrid arrangement. As a team member, you'll report directly to the DRE Mobile Technical Director and engage closely with our internal partner development teams to enhance their engineering journey.

Responsibilities
• Implement internal CI/CD improvement initiatives
• Maintain build automation pipeline with the team
• Collaborate with partner teams to expand and maintain build infrastructure environments
• Identify gaps/toil within build & automation workflows and implement automated scalable, reliable and repeatable solutions
• Monitor and address automated systems issues

Qualifications

Engineering skills:
• Within a computer science or engineering post secondary program
• Exposed to object-oriented/scripting languages (e.g C#, Java, Groovy, Python, Ruby)
• Exposed to cloud platforms (e.g AWS, GCP, Azure)
• Containerization technologies (e.g Docker, Kubernetes)
• Source control management tools (e.g Perforce, Git)
• Virtualization environments and tools (e.g VMs, vSphere)

Soft Skills
• Excellent interpersonal skills and a desire to collaborate
• Excellent analytical skills
• Familiar with Agile methodology
• Manage tasks and responsibilities
• Learn and apply new concepts, principles and solutions

COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS The base salary ranges listed below are for the defined geographic market pay zones in these states. If you reside outside of these locations, a recruiter will advise on the base salary range and benefits for your specific location. EA has listed the hourly pay ranges it in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in the locations listed, as of the time of this posting. Salary offered will be determined based on numerous relevant business and candidate factors including, for example, degree type (e.g. Bachelor’s, Master’s, PhD), what stage you are in your degree journey (i.e. freshman, sophomore, etc.), qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, and business or organizational needs. PAY RANGES
• British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria)
• $65,000 - $70,000 CAD

The hourly pay is just one part of the overall compensation at EA. We also offer a package of benefits including 80 hours per year of sick time (prorated based on scheduled hours per week if less than full-time), 16 paid company holidays per year, medical insurance, and 401(k). Interns in California are also eligible for Voluntary Disability Insurance.

data.job_title: Design Technician & Order Engineering Mechanical Co-op
data.job_description:
This role is a supportive one for the INNIO Order Engineering & Power Generation team, focusing on the design of reciprocating engines and packaged generator sets. The job involves collaborating with global engineering teams to provide product solutions for customers. Tasks include handling Engineering Change Requests to enhance assembly or test process flow, improving customer drawings, and fulfilling custom design requests for new sales. The position requires skills in design, CAD, Bill of Material (BOM) creation, task/project management, and familiarity with INNIO's quality system.

Co-op Term: January 2025 - April 2025

Essential Responsibilities
• Create and modify parametric 3D models and drawings throughout all stages of the design and development process to communicate component design intent using CREO
• Produce 2D drawings which include the application of dimension techniques while considering manufacturability and design intent.
• Create and release complete technical data packages as required for production of new designs.
• Complete all required business system transactions associated with Engineering Change releases as required · Create and release customer documentation packages to provide instruction for Installation, Operation, and Maintenance.
• Use expertise in design/reciprocating engines/gensets to help resolve manufacturing issues
• Participate in project teams as the mechanical Order Engineering resource and complete all design tasks required to release the product to schedule · Participate in technical design reviews
• Provide technical support to other functional areas as required

Qualifications/Requirements
• In the process of completing degree in a related discipline, such as Mechanical Engineering/Technologist.
• Experience working within a manufacturing setting

Desired Characteristics
• Demonstrated design skills to analyze technical requirements and applying appropriate skill set to design and detail system schematics within AutoCAD or other similar 2D CAD software
• Experience designing circuit schematics and wiring diagrams.
• Experience with Pro/Intralink or PDMLINK/Windchill or other CAD file management system would be considered an asset.
• Oracle/SAP Business system experience would be considered an asset.
• Demonstrated proficiency in written, oral, and presentation skills
• Must embrace continuous improvement and have a strong desire to learn
• Demonstrated professional characteristics necessary for working in and leading global teams such as task definition, team building, mentoring and training both local and remote colleagues, collaborative interpersonal skills, and effective communication.

data.job_title: Stagiaire en gestion de projets - hiver 2025
data.job_description:
Job Description

L’opportunité d’emploi :

Il s'agit d'une excellente opportunité pour un professionnel en début de carrière qui cherche à franchir une nouvelle étape et à développer davantage sa carrière dans le secteur de la gestion de projets de construction de bâtiments (institutionnels, industriels, résidentiels).

Vous ferez partie de notre équipe en pleine croissance et utiliserez vos compétences générales et techniques pour collaborer avec vos collègues afin de gérer d'importants projets.En tant qu'assistant de projet, vous aurez la chance de vous impliquer dans diverses tâches à différentes phases, y compris la collaboration avec des parties prenantes internes et externes.Nous recherchons des personnes dotées d’un état d’esprit innovant, capables d’accepter le changement et de collaborer avec nos clients pour parvenir à des solutions fondées sur la valeur.

Pourquoi choisir WSP?
• Nous valorisons une culture d’inclusion et d’appartenance et nous nous engageons à la préserver.
• Notre politique de travail flexible – Nous reconnaissons l’importance de l’équilibre entre nos vies professionnelles et privées et nous vous encourageons à trouver le vôtre. Nous vous soutenons dans toutes les sphères de votre vie de façon à assurer votre entière présence, au travail comme à la maison.
• Une histoire de réussite canadienne – Chez WSP, nous sommes fiers de porter le rouge et blanc de notre magnifique pays et de montrer au monde tout ce que le Canada a à offrir.
• Rendre le monde qui nous entoure meilleur – De l’environnement aux infrastructures routières, en passant par les bâtiments et l’aménagement des terres, WSP façonne notre pays.
• D’excellentes perspectives de carrière – Nous sommes en pleine croissance et chaque jour, nous tâchons de nous surpasser. Nous sommes ouverts à vos idées et souhaitons tenter de nouvelles choses.
• WSP, c’est adopter une culture de collaboration exceptionnelle avec des collègues qui se distinguent aussi bien par leurs compétences que par l’humilité dont ils font preuve dans leur travail d’une grande importance. Venez découvrir notre fantastique équipe!

Nous offrons à nos employés des salaires concurrentiels, des options de travail flexibles, une culture d’entreprise exceptionnelle et des avantages sociaux complets axés sur les employés, dont une plateforme en ligne de santé et de mieux-être, ainsi que des programmes d’épargne intéressants et une vision claire pour l’avenir.

#NousSommesWSP

Ce que vous pouvez vous attendre à faire avec nous:

Collaborer avec/assister le gestionnaire de projet dans les tâches suivantes :
• Collaborer avec/assister la gestionnaire de projet afin de gérer toutes les phases de la réalisation des projets soit la phase du validation, programme fonctionnel et technique, conception et planification, appel d’offre, construction ainsi que la phase d’intégration finale des biens livrables au client et la fermeture des projets dans le cadre de projets dans le domaine de la construction de bâtiments;
• Collaborer avec/assister la gestionnaire de projet dans différentes taches de projet y compris: Gestion de budget et contrôle des coûts / Gestion de la portée / Gestion de l’échéancier / Gestion des partie prenantes et coordination internes et externes/ Gestion de communication (avec le client, les différents intervenants contractuels et les unités fonctionnelles impliquées dans le projet)/ Gestion de la qualité / Gestion des documents / Gestion des risques / Gestion d’approvisionnement et des achats du projet et administration des contrats /Gestion des ressources du projet/ Gestion des changements/ Gestion d’approbations internes et externes
• Effectuer toutes autres tâches connexes pouvant aider à la réalisation du projet.

Ce que vous apporterez à WSP :
• Étudiantes en génie en architecture ou toute autre formation jugée équivalente ;
• Expérience antérieure dans la construction, en génie-conseil, la vente, le militaire, considéré comme un atout;
• Sens de l’initiative, souci du détail;
• Capacité à travailler en équipe;
• Capacité de communication tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit (français et anglais);

About Us

WSP est l’une des plus importantes firmes de services professionnels à travers le monde. Notre mission est d’assurer la pérennité de nos villes et nos environnements.

Notre équipe compte plus de 65 000 membres dans le monde. Au Canada uniquement, nous sommes plus de 12 000 personnes impliquées dans tous les domaines; de l'assainissement de l'environnement à la planification urbaine, de l'ingénierie de bâtiments emblématiques à la réalisation de réseaux de transport durables. Nous trouvons de nouvelles façons d'extraire des ressources essentielles et développons des sources d'énergie renouvelables pour l'avenir.

Chez WSP :
• Nous accordons une grande valeur à nos employés et à notre réputation.
• Nous œuvrons localement, mais avec une envergure internationale.
• Nous sommes axés sur l’avenir et remettons en question le statu quo.
• Nous favorisons la collaboration dans tout ce que nous faisons.
• Nous soutenons une culture d’autonomie et de responsabilisation.

Veuillez noter:

La santé et la sécurité sont des valeurs absolument essentielles pour WSP. Étant donné l’importance de se garder en sécurité, vous devez vous conformer à notre politique de santé, sécurité et environnement (SSE) en tout temps, ainsi qu’aux politiques SSE du client lorsque cela s’applique.

Les offres d'emploi pour des postes impliquant des travaux sur le terrain et assujettis en matière de sécurité sont conditionnelles à ce que les candidats soient en mesure d'effectuer des tâches physiques clés du travail tel que décrit dans l'offre d'emploi et lors de l'entrevue. Cela peut inclure la capacité de travailler dans une variété de conditions environnementales, telles que les régions éloignées ou isolées, travailler seul, et dans des cas de mauvais temps (dans des limites sûres et raisonnables).

L'usage du genre masculin inclut le féminin et n'a été utilisé que pour alléger le texte

WSP accueille et encourage les personnes à mobilité réduite. Les accommodements sont disponibles sur demande pour les candidats qui participent à tous les aspects du processus de sélection.

WSP souscrit au principe de l’équité en matière d’emploi. Seules les candidatures retenues seront contactées.

WSP n’accepte pas les cv spontanés transmis par des agences. Pour obtenir de plus amples renseignements, veuillez lire VEUILLEZ LIRE L’INTÉGRALITÉ DE LA POLITIQUE

Company Description

Veolia Group is a global leader in environmental services, operating across all five continents with nearly 218,000 employees. Specializing in water, energy, and waste management, Veolia Group designs and implements innovative solutions for decarbonization, depollution, and resource regeneration, supporting communities and industries in their ecological transformation. Within this framework, Veolia's Water Technology Business brings together a dedicated team of experienced professionals committed to tackling the world's most complex challenges related to water scarcity, quality, productivity, and energy. Together, we pursue a shared mission to create a more sustainable future.

Job Description

Location: Guelph, ON, Canada

Job Summary about the area and the role:
Veolia Water Technologies & Solutions (VWTS) is a leader in worldwide water recovery, treatment, and reuse. We design and supply a range of water systems, from food and beverage applications to municipal water, microelectronics ultrapure water, and heavy industrial wastewater treatment. We serve over 50,000 customers worldwide and treat more than 11 million cubic meters of water daily.
We aim to be the benchmark company for ecological transformation worldwide.
At VWTS, we realize that diverse teams make smarter decisions, deliver better results, and build stronger communities. We champion diversity and inclusion at every rung of the ladder and are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We offer challenging and meaningful careers with competitive benefits and flexible work arrangements.

Summary of the Job
The R&D Pilot Operator Intern will maintain process testing systems to support the Technology
Team's validation process for new product introductions at pilot levels and full-scale customer sites.
Key Characteristics
Honesty
Accountability
Teamwork

Duties & Responsibilities:
Conduct tests for water and wastewater products and systems, including monitoring,
documentation, chemical dosing, inspections, and communication with test leaders.
Perform analytical laboratory tests and document the results accurately to characterize
process water samples.
Assist with maintaining and modifying fluid system components such as PVC piping spools, valves, pumps, blowers, and calibrating instruments.
Collaborate closely with suppliers to source and procure fluid system components and
consumables, ensuring accurate and timely billing and invoicing.
Provide on-call and weekend support for the testing facility, as needed.
Act as backup for Oakville pilot operator, as needed.
Collaborate with the team on health and safety, maintenance, and improvement activities to ensure safe and efficient facility operations.

Hard Skills:
Hand and power tools
Google Workspace
Microsoft Excel

Soft Skills:
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Motivated learner, willing to learn new skills and take on new tasks.
Self-motivated, ability to work independently and with minimal supervision.
Ability to be flexible in managing multiple tasks with changing priorities.

Qualifications

Education & Experience

Required:
Pursuing a diploma or degree in Mechanical, Chemical, or Environmental
Engineering/Technology or a related technical discipline focused on water/wastewater
treatment.
Valid Ontario G2 or G class driver's license.

Preferred:
Knowledge or experience in water/wastewater treatment, preferably with direct exposure
to membrane products and processes.
Knowledge or experience with fluid systems (piping, pumps, valves, P&ID drawings, etc.).
Knowledge or experience with laboratory methods for water/wastewater analysis.

Additional Information

Working Conditions
Ability to lift equipment or modules weighing up to 30 lbs. occasionally.
Exposure to municipal and industrial wastewater and cleaning chemicals.
The work environments consist of various settings, including office, industrial facilities, and
laboratories.

As an inclusive company, Veolia is committed to diversity and gives equal consideration to all applications, without discrimination.

National Consulting Limited (NCL) is actively seeking an experienced professional to assist in the delivery of Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Anti-Terrorist Financing (ATF) compliance programs requirements to meet the needs of our credit union clients. This position works in conjunction with a team of specialists who report to the VP Business Solutions and works closely with credit unions, legal counsel, and regulators.

The Job

Responsibilities

The successful candidate must be able to work independently and as a team in a remote (work-from-home) position. The key responsibilities of this position include:
• Support the senior role in the delivery of the AML/ATF compliance program to credit union clients.
• With guidance, create and deliver training courses on various AML/ATF related topics.
• Participate in AML/ATF related projects.
• Application of AML/AFT legislative requirements, including record keeping, reporting, monitoring and risk assessments.
• Work in Verafin, Adobe Acrobat, MS Office 365 applications, SharePoint.

This is a permanent, full-time position (37.5 hours per week). Occasional travel and in-person attendance may be required. Computer equipment is supplied.

The Candidate

The Ideal Candidate Will Possess
• 1-4 years’ experience in the credit union or co-operative system providing operational support or in AML and ATF.
• Experience with Verafin.
• Understand regulatory and legislative AML and ATF requirements.
• A Canadian AML, ATF or other regulatory compliance or risk management designation would be beneficial.
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills; you will build trusting relationships with credit union management and deliver excellent client experience.
• As this is a work-from-home position, exceptional organizational and time-management skills are required to succeed in this position.

The Compensation

NCL offers a competitive compensation package. Salary will depend on qualifications and experience. Benefits include a matched superannuation pension plan; group benefits (health, dental, life and disability insurance, healthcare spending allowance and wellness program), and paid personal days off.

If being part of our team interests you, please submit a resume and cover letter, in confidence, by Monday, December 2.

We appreciate the interest of all applicants; however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

National Consulting Limited is owned by a consortium of 25 Saskatchewan credit unions and partners with credit unions across Canada to provide expertise in Risk Services such as Compliance, AML, Fraud Protection, Privacy, Procurement, Banking and Card Services.

data.job_title: Stagiaire - Développement durable intégré aux projets d'infrastructures - 8 mois

data.job_description:
Build the future of the AI Data Cloud. Join the Snowflake team.

Snowflake started with a clear vision: develop a cloud data platform that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. Snowflake developed an innovative new product with a built-for-the-cloud architecture that combines the power of data warehousing, the flexibility of big data platforms, and the elasticity of the cloud at a fraction of the cost of traditional solutions. We are now a global, world-class organization with offices in more than a dozen countries and serving many more.

We’re looking for dedicated students who share our passion for ground-breaking technology and want to create a lasting future for you and Snowflake.
WHAT WE OFFER:
• Paid, full-time internships in the heart of the software industry
• Post-internship career opportunities (full-time and/or additional internships)
• Exposure to a fast-paced, fun and inclusive culture
• A chance to work with world-class experts on challenging projects
• Opportunity to provide meaningful contributions to a real system used by customers
• High level of access to supervisors (manager and mentor), detailed direction without micromanagement, feedback throughout your internship, and a final evaluation
• Stuff that matters: treated as a member of the Snowflake team, included in company meetings/activities, flexible hours, casual dress code, accommodations to work from home, swag and much more
• When return to office in effect, catered lunches, access to gaming consoles, recreational games, happy hours, company outings, and more

WHAT WE EXPECT:
• Desired class level: 3rd/4th year Undergraduates, Masters, or PhD
• Desired majors: Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or related field
• Required coursework: algorithms, data structures, and operating systems
• Recommended coursework: cloud computing, database systems, distributed systems, and real-time programming
• Bonus experience: working experience, research or publications in databases or distributed systems, and contributions to open source
• When: Spring 2025 (January - April 2025)
• Duration: 12 week minimum, 12-16 weeks recommended
• Excellent programming skills in C++ or Java
• Knowledge of data structures and algorithms
• Strong problem solving and ability to learn quickly in a dynamic environment
• Experience with working as a part of a team
• Dedication and passion for technology

WHAT YOU WILL LEARN/GAIN:
• How to build enterprise grade, reliable, and trustworthy software/services
• Exposure to SQL or other database technologies
• Understanding of database internals, large-scale data processing, transaction processing, distributed systems, and data warehouse design
• Implementation, testing of features in query compilation, compiler design, query execution
• Experience working with cloud infrastructure, AWS, Azure, and/or Google Cloud in particular
• Learning about cutting edge database technology and research

POSSIBLE TEAMS/WORK FOCUS AREAS:
• Data Applications Infrastructure, Data Marketplace, Data Privacy, Data Sharing
• High performance large-scale data processing
• Large-scale distributed systems
• Software-as-a-Service platform
• Software frameworks for stability and performance testing

Every Snowflake employee is expected to follow the company’s confidentiality and security standards for handling sensitive data. Snowflake employees must abide by the company’s data security plan as an essential part of their duties. It is every employee's duty to keep customer information secure and confidential.

Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.

How do you want to make your impact?

November 28, 2024

THE RENFREW COUNTY DISTRICT SCHOOL BOARD

requires a

TEMPORARY ACCOUNTING CLERK II - FINANCE

LOCATION:

Board Administration Office, Pembroke

Schedule

7 hours per day, 35 hours per week, 12 months per year

Rate Of Pay

$27.72- $28.55 (Group 6)

Start Date

Immediately

End Date

July 7, 2025 (or return of incumbent)

Application Deadline

December 4, 2024 at 12:00 p.m.

Qualifications

Two year post secondary diploma in business and / or finance. Minimum of 6 to 12 months experience required. The applicant must comprehensively use software including accounting software, spreadsheets, word processing and web based applications. Communicate effectively and concisely, both orally and in writing. Work effectively independently as well as in a team environment. Strong organizational and time management skills, with particular attention to detail. Handle sensitive and confidential material with discretion and ensure protection of information. Focus on providing excellent customer service by identifying and meeting customer needs, using processes and procedures that are customer oriented and seeking solutions to resolve service issues.

Duties

Under the direction of the Payroll and Accounting Supervisors, supports both the Payroll and Accounting Departments (approximately 50% in each department) produces the bi-weekly and monthly payrolls including making adjustments; maintains employee records; deals with enquiries; remitting reports to outside agencies; compiling and distributing internal reports; review and code and enter invoices for payment; match invoices with approved purchase orders; enter journal entries and accounts receivable invoices; communicate with personnel and suppliers regarding payment of invoices.

Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. All other applicants are thanked for their interest.

All offers of employment are conditional upon receipt of a current vulnerable sector screening and educational qualifications acceptable to the District.

Please advise Human Resources (hrdept@rcdsb.on.ca) prior to the closing date if you require accommodation at any time throughout the application process so the appropriate arrangements can be made.

The Renfrew County District School Board is committed to equity, diversity and inclusion in our employment practices. For more information please visit the RCDSB Careers page.
